discourse_list.title: [Signal Request- Withdrawn] Raise Gelato UNI .05% Stability Fee to 5 Basis Points

content.content: Edited to withdraw. I didn’t realize someone was already working to raise fees above 0. Thanks everyone! Summary Should the stability fee for Gelato UNI .05% collateral be raised from 0 to 5 basis points. The GUNI .05% vault type is at/near record highs. With 570,392,000 DAI issued from this vault type, it seems obvious that Maker should begin getting some revenue for it. After discussion with others, I am signaling to raise the stability fee for this vault type from 0% to .05%. Annualized from current levels, that is 285,000 DAI in revenue. The main reason to institute a small fee is that Maker derives no revenue from it currently, demand is very high, and the token itself is revenue generating and can support some amount of fee. The main reason not to charge a fee is that it might negatively impact DAI supply from this vault type.    Raise fees to 5 basis points on GUNI .05% collateral type?  Yes No Abstain     0 voters     This poll was closed early because I withdrew this signal request
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is proposing to raise the stability fee for Gelato UNI .05% collateral from 0 to 5 basis points. The post explains the reasons for and against the proposal and includes a poll for voting. The post was later edited to withdraw the proposal. The post also includes questions and constructive criticism from third parties.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: I think I messed up this poll and didn’t get the right forum trust level I was advised to use. Can @GovAlpha-Core-Unit help me out when able? I’m already on my second attempt at the poll and don’t think I’m building it correctly
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: Considering 50x Apy at the moment is 3.74%, raising stability fee to 0.05% would reduce total APY to 1.2%. Now hopefully with increased trading volume (which used to have 25% APY), it might go up, but at least for now, it wouldn’t be quite profitable, and might end up unwinding a lot of Dai. So unless the recommendation comes from Risk team, I am hesistant
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Agreed with Doo. Additionally, there is already a proposal from the parameter proposal group to raise it to 1 bps: Parameter Changes Proposal - PPG-OMC-001 - 30 June 2022
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: voting no as well - I do agree that the protocol should get a fair cut, but we shouldn’t overshoot. the MOMC proposal is a step into this direction
Hi Selena, looks like the correct trust level has been selected so I haven’t changed anything for now.
This topic was automatically closed 30 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
